Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short stay”
Reviews.Author: uglybetty-7
Reviews.Content: Arrived early so the rooms were not ready for us, however we were able to leave our luggage in the secure room so no problem. On our return we were checked in quickly and shown to our budget room. Our first thought was how small the room was, barely enough room at the bottom of the bed to walk around. Stangely the bathroom was a good size in comparison. The bedroom had very little wardrobe space or anywhere to store suitcases. There was no view out of the window, just overlooked a quadrangle area overlooked by other bedrooms on all sides so you had to keep the blinds shut for privacy. and you could not even see the sky. On the plus side the rooms were modern and had everything you need, i.e. iron and ironing board, fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, good tv. And the bathroom has plenty of toiletries but no shelves. The walls are wafer thin so careful what you are up to. Nice little lounge area and bar. Handy for the trains and a 15/20 minute walk to Circular Quay straight down Pitt St. Paddys Market and China town a 5minute walk away. We stayed for 3 nights which is about as long as you would want in that size room. Any longer pay a bit more and upgrade to a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Standing Ovation”
Reviews.Author: Edgar L
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in the Metro Hotel to lodge my mother who came to visit after several years of not seeing me during our short stop at Sydney. I wanted to impress her but the budget was limited so after careful consideration of several hotels, I chose Metro thinking it average-to-good, but fairly priced and a bit wary after reading a few very negative reviews. I was VERY surprised when I found out the spacious room, super-comfortable beds, pleasant decor and top-notch cleaniness. Moreover, I managed to catch a free WIFI offer and I couldn't believe how reliable and fast it was (not to mention unlimited,) I don't even get such a good Internet at home paying premium for it! As others have said, it's also conveniently located in the middle of the CBD with the Opera House on walking distance. The only complaint was a rather ugly but not too big faded stain in the carpet which I guess is what people who post negative reviews get hung on?If you are paying over $300 in a 5-star hotel that might be a valid concern, but when you are getting such a great value for your buck (4-star quality for under $120 a night!) you shouldn't mind secondary details like that. Old lifts were ugly and slow but I got there right when they were replacing them, now they are state-of-the-art which shows that even being on top of their game they strive to improve even further. I just hope that won't affect their prices because I'm planning to keep lodging there for all my future travels to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Royalequus
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed with this hotel. Location pretty good, but rooms are small and shabby and there are pretty much no services. Not worth the price at all, would rather spend an extra $100 to stay in a better hotel closer to Darling Harbour. Definitely wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Good Experience - March 2012”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCanadianMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in March 2012. The room was very clean and small (but size of room is understandable given price and location). It is a fair price for such a convenient downtown location in Sidney's CBD (approximately 2-3 blocks from subway stations). It was decently quiet for such a central location (asked for a room facing away from the main street). Front desk customer service was also very good and helpful. Didn't plan on eating at hotel restaurant, but happened to eat a breakfast sandwich one morning and was happily surprised. The restaurant price seemed high at first, but portions were generous and it tasted delicious. Some interesting things about Sidney: shopping/eating hours in the CBD are terrible (e.g. most places in CBD close down at 5pm or soon thereafter); buying the weekly MyMulti + Airport Link is well worth the money if planning to stay more than 4-5 days and taking public transit to beaches (e.g. Bondi and Manly), Fish Market, etc.)...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Metro on Pitt!”
Reviews.Author: Archie Y
Reviews.Content: Think twice about booking at the Metro on Pitt. We booked the top room (King Spa) for an anniversary getaway. On the first night we had a spa. Afterwards we let the plug out and went into the bedroom to find all the water had somehow drained through the side wall and the carpet in the bedroom was under water. Promptly called the manager, who offered us another room. We spent 15 minutes packing all our belongings up, trekked down to reception, and received a new room key without a single apology or ANY offer of compensation whatsoever. Usually I wouldn't say anything but I asked what kind of compensation we could be given. I was told the only thing he could offer us were 2 for 1 drink vouchers next door... Wow a free drink if we still BUY one ourselves... we felt like management really cared. So we lugged our things up to the 7th floor (our room had been on the first floor) and got into our new room to find it had 2 single beds in it... clearly NOT the same room we booked. Back down to reception, no apology, new room key, back up to level 7 and finally another identical room. All this at 10:30pm on a Friday night, a perfect way to spend a relaxing anniversary night after a nice dinner and spa, thanks Metro! So anyway, there was nothing special about the hotel (location was good but there are many other hotels with the same or better location) and you definitely can't depend on management caring about your enjoyment levels so I would HIGHLY recommend looking elsewhere for your hotel needs in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitepointer
Reviews.Content: If your reading this review - your probably thinking how can it be an Over priced budget hotel, well thats because its a budget hotel by standard and is charging way too much for what it offers. I wouldnt stay there again. Crappy room fixtures, Limited TV channels, Small room & bathroom. Air con is good, Tea and coffee making in room, Steam Iron & Ironing board, Paid internet access, Friendly staff at reception, centrally located, resturant next door and loads of resturant or pub options nearby. Quite a walk to Myers shopping center (example of nearby centres). 2 blocks from museum railway station. No mini bar in room - vending maching at recption. Standard old style TV. Great view of a brick wall from the window. Shower only no bath. Beds must be close together because the room is so small There are lots of better options in Sydney for what you would pay for this small dog box room.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: macsla255349
Reviews.Content: I was booked by someone else to stay here for three nights at a time when accommodation in Sydney seemed to be at a premium - the first night cost $335,the second $270 and the third was $190 for a "deluxe twin" room. Absolutely not worth anything like that sort of money! My room was on the second floor, overlooking Pitt Street - I was repeatedly disturbed by traffic noise and the monorail going past. The room was basically adequate and clean (an improvement on a previous stay at this place). Shower screen door didn't close properly so water went all over the floor each time I showered. The mattress had springs sticking up in odd places and was seriously uncomfortable - I didn't sleep well for the whole three nights. Internet via their broadband connection costs an additional $15, but I could not make a connection, even after trying for a couple of hours; possibly, this is a perennial problem with this establishment as they have a section in the room guide specifically devoted to "troubleshooting" your computer to deal with connection problems. When I asked for help with this, the staff simply said "sorry, it should be showing up". Service - on check-in it was good, and the housekeeping staff must be good as my room was kept clean [that's a huge improvement on a previous occasion]. Check-out was a nightmare that I struggled through. The check-out staff member that I got just wasn't with it at all! He took my credit card, then didn't give me either the receipt or the card back: just the invoice. When I handed over the room key, I gave him two luggage chits for cases that I had previously placed in their luggage storage facility. I had to repeat my request to get my cases and the fellow then started filling out a chit to put my other case into storage. I repeated that I wanted to get bags out from the storage, not put them in. Then he started asking for my luggage chits (which I suspect he may have thrown into the bin with the doorkey folder) and looked totally blank when I said I'd just given them to him. Ultimately, something that should have taken a few minutes took nearly 15 minutes. Not a good way to end an expensive, ordinary time there!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Metro, park at the rydges and LUG your bags thru the city”
Reviews.Author: RobbedByCambridge
Reviews.Content: When I was checking in I asked how to get to their carpark. When I was told it's at the World Square I was shocked. I asked the guy "so how am I going to lug 3 bags and an esky FULL of beer and ice" he said I can catch a cab... After trying to get a cab, to no avail, I ended up dragging my bags through the city and pulling a muscle in my arm doing so. Things didn't get any better with the room or meals and their staff were less than helpful. I'd rather camp in the boot of my car then stay here again. I don't even look at them when planning my stays in the city.

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for this hotel which is well placed particularily for those on their first visit to Sydney. It is right in the city centre, minutes away from the widest array of shops, Chinatown is just down the road and all transport is within a block. The free city bus gets you to Circular Quay for all the ferries. The room was quite small but adequate for our needs. The staff are all friendly, free papers in the morning and the adjoining Paradise restuarant is good value if you don't want to explore the great choice of restuarants in this city. And the added bonus (even though we were on a deal) was they gave us Qantas air miles for our stay. We will use this hotel again on our next visit as it is easy to get to see our friends in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jan p
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpfull people. The Paradise restaurant is great value and offer free WI-FI.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Helpful But Expensive or is that just Sydney?”
Reviews.Author: mordi35
Reviews.Content: Dropped in here whilst on a conference at Darling Harbour. Room was quite small, only a half window looking onto the roof nextdoor. It was clean and shower was good quality. No wireless internet, just a cable that you can get from reception - speed was OK once connected. It is adjacent to the monrail station (its about 100metres away) that took me straight to Darling Harbour. Cafe downstairs was a bit boring but they made good coffee and had good basic breakfast, plus buffet breakfast also. Bit pricey but the rest of Sydney was worse so maybe thats what you have to pay in Sydney?

Reviews.Title: “Small, well located with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Shirley W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a business trip. I was intially grumpy when told only a twin bed room was available and particularly so when the card didn't appear to work in the lift or room door. But the desk staff immediately accompanied me up to my room, establishing with no fuss that the fault was in my technique, not the card. The room was small with a view of a wall but the bathroom was fine, the air conditioning worked really well and the beds were King Single and comfortable. The carpet was a little old but everything else looked (and smelled) fresh and clean. There is a bistro downstairs which female travellers in particular may find useful, although I didn't eat there, so I can't comment on the food. Checking out was a smooth process and the staff member was happy to hail a cab for me on his own initiative. I was pleasantly surprised and would happily stay here for one night again, although I'd prefer a larger room if I was staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good clean rooms although a very small”
Reviews.Author: ozzie_lizzie
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walking distance to CBD and shopping, and walk to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay etc. Like other reviewers, I found the rooms really small (I did stay in a budget room), but fine for one night for one person. Although small, the rooms had everything that you would need, and space was well used. Bathrooms were a good size. Room was really clean. I had an opening window which was great, although no view (brick wall only). For short stays, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fair value great location”
Reviews.Author: wetravellots101
Reviews.Content: we stay here in transit through Sydney, just a few days at a time and its perfect for that. Rooms are small but functional and the location to Chinatown and theater is excellent. You can stroll from Central station (even with bags) and there is an airport shuttle from the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stanmarut
Reviews.Content: This was a nice "boutique" type hotel right in the heart of Sydney and very close to major public transportation, the harbour and within easy reach of the airport by train. The hotel has obviously been developed from an older building but was very acceptable. The room we had was slightly strangely configured as it wrapped around the rear of the elevator shaft but had lots of room and was very quiet. There was a window which looked out to the yard but no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: cabmanHerts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights prior to cruise,we arrived quite late and were given keys to room,we had to take our own luggage on trolley.when we entered our room we were quite disappointed,it was small,dingy,and had no room safe.The next morning we told the pleasant young lady at the desk and she arranged for an upgrade at no charge.This turned out to be a much nicer room,not luxurious,but adequate.The location is ideal,close to everything,much in walking distance.All in all i would recommend this hotel,providing you were not given the dingy small rooms that we had in the first instance,i would also recommend the pub two streets down from the hotel,i think its called Molloys,good value,with an excellent buffet on tuesdays for $8.95

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: BRIAN M
Reviews.Content: We found the Metro to be very well located for connection from the airport by train near Town hall station and only 5 minutes walk to the CBD and Pitt st mall.The rooms ,we had a superior queen,spacious and clean and friendy staff

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Puppiespaws
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, it was very very clean and very well kept. Our room was a little small but perfect for what we were needed. Bathroom was a very good size and so was the shower. The main shopping mall was extremely close and everything you need to access in Sydney is within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: EtheB
Reviews.Content: Good location - close to shopping centres and monorail. Clean & tidy rooms. Reasonable parking rates - albeit 2 blocks away. Bathroom small but functional. No view to speak of, but about what you'd expect for the price in this part of town. Very basic buffet hot/cold breakfasts available ($16). Friends were in a "standard" room whereas we were in a "superior". Descriptions seem a little optimistic. Friends didn't get much sleep (in 2 seperate rooms), and neither did I thanks to the jet engine of an air conditioner. All up - ok, but I'll look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: CHG_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Location was good but I have stayed in a lot better hotels for this price. Room was small but clean & quiet (view was non-existent). Bathroom was tired & shower adequate. Restaurant was ok-buffet breakfast was adequate albeit uninspired for $16 but the staff made up for it with their helpfulness. Other meals were ok. Don't pay hotel for wifi as it is free in the restaurant. Watch out for the extras- $100 refundable deposit & credit card surcharges. Laundry prices high albeit service is good. In all, you must balance negatives against what is a great location, good staff & convenience

Reviews.Title: “Just missing a couple of things for the female traveller”
Reviews.Author: Tracy J
Reviews.Content: I just stayed three nights in this hotel. Great location, nice rooms and friendly staff. Besides the traffic noise when you are trying to sleep, as a female traveller I missed two things - there is no decent light in the bathroom (don't try putting on your make-up in your room) and no full length mirror to check out the new clothes you bought from Myer. Also, I was charged twice for something I bought from the "automatic" mini-bar in the foyer. The desk clerk tried to tell me it was my own fault, even though I told him one of the staff members made the purchase for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: edmundsd
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here as a stopover before an international flight. The hotel was clean and we booked a superior room to have the extra space due to suitcases and had heard the rooms could be quite small. This room had plenty of space so no complaints there - definitely worth the extra money! Rooms were quite dark but bathroom was alot better and was huge. The biggest problem was the bed - rock hard! Neither of us got a good nights sleep. The location is definitely the number one thing about this hotel and could not have been more perfect for sightseeing and shopping. Would have to toss up whether the location was worth the terrible bed if we were visiting again ... The $100 credit card hold was a bit strange, havent seen that around at all in my many travels (both domestic and international) Apart from that we had a good experience here and would definitely consider it again

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jay B
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel very early in the morning and not expecting to be able to check in was given the key to the room. Very impressed as many places will not let you check in even 1 hour in advance. We stayed in a twin share room, which although small was to be expected as I had booked the cheapest option. The room was very clean and smelt fresh. The bathroom has been updated and provides toiletries. Yes the TV is not an LCD/Plasma but I tend to spend most of my time sightseeing so this was not an issue. The room was a little dark due to not much natural sunlight as the room was on the 1st floor surrounded by other taller buildings, but again not something that worried us (many hotels in Asia have windowless rooms!) There is a pub next door but the room itself was very quiet. The aircon is a little noisy but not so loud that it kept you awake. Locked luggage storage is available which is handy when your flight home is not until late. Fantastic location, within minutes from Town Hall train station and the Pitt Street Mall. 5-10 minutes to Chinatown/Darling Harbour, walking distance to Kings Cross and Circular Quay. There is a Woolworths a block away. For the price you pay I was more than happy with what we got. The customer service was great and I have already recommended this hotel to a friend who is planning a trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “HOUSE AWAY FROM HOUSE”
Reviews.Author: RAJESH G
Reviews.Content: i have stayed with my family for a week in this hotel and i found good friendly staff,hospitality,excellent housekeeping moreover its worth staying in this hotel,it is in the centre of sydney so all shopping,tourist places and restaurents are near by. rajesh garg barnala

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: lindeo
Reviews.Content: Positives:This hotel is ideally located in the CBD of Sydney with only a short walk to trains, buses and the monorail. Our room was very quiet. Negatives: Do not believe the 4-star rating. The furntiture is old and very worn, the bed is the hardest bed I have ever (NOT) slept on and the TV is small and old. Our alarm clock was broken and the alarm went off at midnight every night. There is no plug in the basin and management told me they do not supply them. There was no power-point near the electric jug so had to use the one in the bathroom to make tea/coffee. The rooms look out onto other rooms. The fan in the bathroom runs constantly and the air-conditioning is VERY loud.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jeff191962
Reviews.Content: Although the Hotel is reasonably clean and tidy, the position within the CBD is ideal. I am not happy with the overall service and the quoted price doesn't necessarily mean the price you will pay. One month after visiting the Hotel I got a credit card charge for an additiona $32. When I rang the Hotel to find out why, I was told that at the time of booking they had given me the wrong price, the reason I booked the Hotel was due to the price. When I tried to argue the point I was told that in the fine print it is stipulated that this 'could' occur. Not good enough and I have no recorse but to make it public.

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic, but the four star rating is very optimistic - I would not pay full price”
Reviews.Author: jc7679
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in 4-star hotels and honestly I would say this is a 3 at best. I stayed on a Travelzoo deal and the location was brilliant as was the proximity to train stations (Museum and Town Hall). The staff are lovely, free newspapers are a wondeful perk and the baggage hold is much appreciated. However - after checking in and up to my small room, I found the main light didn't work so had to find all the lamps in the dark. Then I went for a drink of water and the first glass I picked up had a huge crack in it. And when I went to grab my book from the bedside table it stuck due to some sticky mess underneath so I ended up having to clean that up too and lay my things on newspaper given I have no idea what the mess was. Not great for a first night. I also do not understand why the hotel has the $100 credit card deposit charge on check in (refunded in a few days), when there is no mini bar and the fittings are dated so I can't imagine anyone would want to nick them. The shower was weak, there was bits of rust in corners, and toiletries are dispensed from very 70s push pumps - definitely not 4-star characteristics. I would stay here again on a deal price purely because of location and the room was sufficient if a little run down, but I would definitely not pay full price and I do believe the four star is a self-rating.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean room but typical of Metro”
Reviews.Author: BellaOlive
Reviews.Content: Room was small and non fuss. The heater was like sleeping next to a loud exhaust fan. and the TV is outdated. However the value was pretty good and all of the staff were lovely. The Metro on Pitt is in an excellent location. Forget the restuarant downstairs Sydney has too many choices for far better coffee. The shower was ok but the shower door didn't close properly and the room in general appeared a little run down. No view to speak of but had opening windows. The bed was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cailinnagaillimhe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well maintained however our room was very small compared to other hotels in this price range and quite dark. En-suite bathroom was lovely and had nice toiletries - but I did get trapped in the shower as the glass door was broken and had to be rescued by my boyfriend!! Avoid the "buffet breakfast" at all costs - For $16AUS per person it was extremely disappointing - fresh fruit was NOT fresh, bread stale, hot food looked and tasted like it had been sitting there hours. We ended up having just toast and juice as the rest looked repulsive!! Some of the staff at reception were not very approachable/ mannerly. Excellent location - within walking distance of all major sights - Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Observation Tower, Paddy's Market, Chinatown and Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modest accommodation”
Reviews.Author: omni01
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, which is excellent. Everything else was OK. The hotel felt very impersonal from the moment that you walk in. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and have the basic amenities. I was there on business so needed internet - their internet was cabled and had to go back downstairs to reception to get the username, password AND an ethernet cable (apparently they expect people to bring their own). Staff was helpful and polite. In summary, I think you could probably do better for the amount that you pay...but it's not a bad option.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: dlwAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Grubby, cramped, noisy and no shower curtain in the ensuite meaning the room was sprayed with water on each use. I have stayed here before and each time the standard gets steadily worse. Location is fantastic but for a 'superior' room I would expect a cover on the quilt, not just a sheet tucked around it. Won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Yuck.”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaJayne05
Reviews.Content: Dark hallways, dingy rooms, moldy bathrooms. Cheap for a central location, but never again. Uncomfortable beds. Light fittings were broken. Very little lights in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hote!”
Reviews.Author: Sully2971
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely beautiful with many amenities! The attached restaurant had outstanding service! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: MissGJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily for the location, knowing that we wouldn't be in the room much we weren't too worried about the size of the room. We required a twin room and wanted something clean and secure. The Metro on Pitt exceeded our expectations, we paid a very reasonable rate for a twin room and it was clean and had good facilities. The room was small and probably not a room you would book for a long term trip but for a weekend getaway it was more than sufficient. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: VittalKS
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior deluxe room on a Friday and Saturday rooms are neat and clean.. i enjoyed this stay here.. Great location in the centre and easy to access to shopping, city tour buses, bars, restaurants, Darling Harbor, station etc. near to mono rail station..

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Les41
Reviews.Content: Nothing to fault about this hotel. Very clean, friendly staff. We were upgraded to superior room which was very nice and quite spacious. Not sure what the standard rooms are like. Close to Central station and good choice of eating places nearby. A bit of a trek to the Central Quay however although there is a free bus you can get which is a block away. The breakfast wasn't really worth $15 and you can better and cheaper meals elsewhere. All in all a good reasonable priced place to stay while in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: I paid a negligible amount to upgrade from the basic room to a "superior deluxe queen". I donâ€™t know what the basic rooms are like, but I did find the superior room very acceptable, with enough room to swing a cat and stow a suitcase in the corner. Total cost for a two night stay was $325. My room also had a good flat screen TV which had a number of Foxtel pay-TV channels. I am not certain if this would be a feature of the cheaper rooms here. Other reviewers on this site have mentioned the issue of noise. It is noticeable, but it didnâ€™t bother me too much. I was on the fifth floor and was aware of a dull roar every now and then. However, the hotel is located on Pitt Street and the Sydney Monorail does run along the street below, so if the central location is what you want, you will have to tolerate the noise that goes with it. Provided you don't require complete silence, you should be able to get used to it quite easily. The location is fantastic and is very close to amenities, Museum Station, shops, cafes and all other locations of the Sydney CBD. The bed was very comfortable and the cleanliness of the room was fine. I have no complaints there. Wi-Fi is NOT free, so if you do see it listed on room features, remember it isnâ€™t complimentary. It costs $5.00 per hour or $15.00 per day. Provided I can get this hotel at a good price through booking websites again (I used www.lastminute.com.au), I would happily return here.

Reviews.Title: “Have Fun in Sydney even for a day”
Reviews.Author: Rina_Z88
Reviews.Content: First time in Australia...Metro on Pitt is just the right one for our budget & safe place. Price AUD$130+/ nite. Small room but good shower with room amenities...despite nov view for window for our room. To enjoy the sights...U'll be in the room just for shower & sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Please differentiate this from the other Metro on the same street”
Reviews.Author: SoloFinn
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get to the right Metro on Pitt Str 300 ; there is another one closer to the main station (Pitt 431). Great location in the centre and easy to access to shopping, city tour buses, bars, restaurants, Darling Harbor, station etc. The air conditioning can be turned off - thanks for that! The hotel staff is helpful in booking trips and airport shuttle and the small restaurant is nice. Coffee/tea maker and small fridge is great to have, as well as ironing equipment. The bathroom is big and offers shampoo, conditioner, body/hand lotion. All in all i liked the hotel. slight minuses: A brick wall view from window and the fact that during my 9 nights stay i had to settle my bill once it had gone over 500 AUD. This felt extremely strange as the credit card had been given for guarantee. I have never had this in any hotels during my long years of travelling both in business and leisure. I would suggest you inform about this in your booking confirmation, as this is supposed to be the hotel standard policy. Regards to the couple next door: the sound isolation is very weak.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place at all!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as another I often use was not available. The per night price was middle ground, but the room was quite big and very comfortable. I have seen other reviews that say there are very small rooms - but that was not my experience on this occasion. You could hear a local nightclub during the night - but not so much that it interrupted sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad but bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: 2Pickie
Reviews.Content: We were hesistant about booking at this hotel after reading all the bad reviews on trip advisor but because other hotels were expensive we decided to give this place a go. We stayed in a superior deluxe room on a Friday and Saturday night and on booking we requested a quiet room on a higher floor. We were given a room on the highest floor (7th) which faced Pitt Street. Although facing the mono rail we thought being so high up the noise would be minimum but the traffic , mono rail and aeroplane noise can be irritating when you are trying to sleep. I had to sleep with ear plugs on the Saturday night after coming home from a bar at 12.00am because the pub next door had Karaoke on. This hotel is not so bad and we give this hotel the 3 G's and that is Good Location, Good Value/Price and Good Room Size. Please note that the room we stayed in had no bath tub but that was not a problem for us. If you can sleep through anything this a good hotel to explore sydney.

Reviews.Title: “All very good but...”
Reviews.Author: Topgun15
Reviews.Content: The water pressure is lousy. Barely dribbles out of the shower and you have to run around to get wet! Maybe it was the seventh floor but still not good enough. Monorail makes a bit of noise but bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing at all exciting, but servicable”
Reviews.Author: Amelia J
Reviews.Content: I needed a reasonaly cheap place to spend a night in central Sydney and this seemed to fit the bill. The room (a superior queen because the cheaper ones were unavailable) was fine. It was small, but clean. The bathroom had soap, shampoo, conditioner, moisturiser but in dispensers rather than small containers. It was quiet, and the bed, while nothing special was fine and I slept well. The service was correct but was limited to the arrangements around checking in and out. They did hold my bags while I was out for the morning after checking out though which was appreciated. The location is good - close to the CBD and a range of attractions, which was a big reason behind booking the hotel. I wouldn't recommend it for longer stays because of the room size. I won't automatically go back here next time I'm in Sydney, but would stay here again if the price was right. I was in a hurry when I was looking and broke the rule of checking the hotel's own website as well as the prices on the hotel finding websites - it would have been as cheap or cheaper to book straight with the hotel and I always think that gives you a bit more leverage if something goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Never a 4 star hotel in a million years!”
Reviews.Author: S_yorksStev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (2 couples) over the new year period 2010/11. We had considerable difficulty in finding a suitable hotel over the new year period in Sydney despite starting the process in April 2010 principally due to the poor performance of our travel company. However, we were eventually assured that this place was a decent 4 star hotel in a good location so we went for it. The location is fine, it's a 10min walk straight down Pitt to Circular Quay. However this is never a 4 star hotel! The rooms were clean but extremely small (we were unable to unpack all our clothing) with a view directly into neighboring bedrooms in the hotel. Our friends room had a large damp patch in the corner hidden by strategically placed furniture. The reception is pokey and the property is advertised as having two lifts but only has one. This single lift was broken down for 3 out of the 7 days we were here and we were told to use a small service lift which was always in use by the cleaners, you can imagine the waiting around time. The hotel has what appears to be a franchised dining / cafe area which can be accessed directly from the road. We were bed and breakfast but soon forgot the breakfast as it was poor to say the least, you had to boil a kettle to get a cup of coffee, the food was greasy and looked as though it had been there for ever. All in all a very poor experience and one that I couldn't recommend to anyone unfortunately!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: Ansiepansie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the metro for 1 night and that was 1 night too many! We were booked into an executive queen suite, this turned out to simply be a room with a bed and a very small adjoining room with a couch. It seemed very strange that the television was in the bedroom and not the lounge! The television also had very limited channels (only 4 cable channels) and the in room movie system did not work. The staff were nice enough but did not go out of their way to help. The air conditioning was very below standard and the rooms feel moist and very humid. There wasalso a very unpleasant smell of bleach from the bathroom that permeated through the whole suite. Will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location makes up for average room”
Reviews.Author: aion12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a queen room and then later upgraded to a king spa, for a mix of business and pleasure. Overall it was a pleasant stay and I would likely return because of the location. However I would not return if I was traveling for business and I was going to be in the room the whole time and I needed a working iron. - Front desk service were nice and helpful. - Internet was broken when I was there - Brilliant location, it was very easy to go back and dump shopping before heading out again - Beds were too mushy - Iron and ironing board were terrible Queen room: - Seemed kind of small - Tiny window looking onto nothing - Good bathroom - Tiny CRT TV - Tiny desk - LOUD aircon King room: - Decently large - Sofa, coffee table, arm chair, and a long desk - LCD tv remote was broke, picture quality was pretty crap. - The 'spa' was a bathtub with some jets - very good curtains that blocked out the majority of the light

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jasperagate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Metro on Pitt over the Christmas period 2010, the Hotel is a short walk from Town hall station and in the heart of the shopping area of Sydney CBD. The hotel was clean and reasonably appointed, the reception was bright and clean and the staff were friendly, the attached bar and restaurant was well priced and clean. The room was small, but enough for the two of us, for 6 nights, the only down side was the lack of any view from the room, unless you like looking at a wall, but this should not put you off as there is plenty of things to do outside in Sydney rather than staying in the hotel. There is a Woolworths supermarket 2 blocks from the hotel. There is an Avis rental car outlet 2 blocks from the hotel. I would highly reccomend this hotel for location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Triple glazing the front windows should drown out the noise!!”
Reviews.Author: KTJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business. First the taxi driver took me to the wrong Metro hotel (there is also one further down Pitt street) When I got here, the checkin staff were great and had even upgraded my room to a newly fitted out one. That was all good. However, a hotel on Pitt Street is going to be noisy - and I didnt realise at time of booking that it was directly opposite the monorail track. So I was woken up when that was active and when there were other city maintenance type noises (garbage collection, street cleaning etc.) as silly o clock in the morning.# The room service was shocking - I was feeling lazy on day 1 - but wished I had gotten my shoes on and walked around the corner for a chinese meal for less than half the price!.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but need more communication among staff”
Reviews.Author: Happytourist098
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, they said our room was not ready and they asked us to go back in 2 hours. So we went back in 1 hour, but they said it's still not ready. We ended up waiting at the hotel lobby for another 2 hours. Turned out that other hotel staff did not know the room was for us, so they gave it to a couple that just arrived the hotel. We ended up having to wait again for the next available room. Apart from the super long wait for our room, the hotel is nice and it is very convenient. I would recommend staying at this hotel, just make sure they don't give your room away to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: gk_assoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days. Checked out yesterday. We have travelled extensively around Australia and the world so have experienced many different standards of hotels from 5 star to terrible. Staff excellent, friendly and helpful. I chose this hotel for its proximity to my husband's meeting location. I was a little concerned due to its star rating however it was clean, everything was in working order, no noise which was a surprise as it is on such a busy road. We had a superior room and it had heaps of room. Will definitely recommend to family or friends and we will stay again when next in Sydney G of Brisbane

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mel_Cry
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Metro Hotel on Pitt. The location is great - it's near Darling Harbour, close to 2 monorail stations, and a short walk to 2 train stations. The room was clean and neat. We were well looked after, the staff were helpful and went out of their way to be helpful. Staff were willing to hold our luggage (and put a special bottle of wine on ice for us) until our room was ready for check-in if we arrived before the room was ready, and keep our bags in a safe storage room so we could walk around and do the tourist thing more easily after check out. The restaurant downstairs had a delicious selection of meals - we enjoyed the BLT and beer battered fish. For a special dinner with that special someone, we recommend Steerson's Steakhouse on Lime St (King St Wharf), only a short walk away! Close to tourist attractions like Centrepoint Tower, Darling Harbour, and World Square.

Reviews.Title: “While good location, hotel lacked cleanliness and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: meanlandlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, near the best shopping downtown and walkable to many restaurants --- as well as easy walk to the Circular Quay and Opera House during the day. This was the end of a 4 week journey in Australia and it was the most disappointing hotel. The blanket on the bed was filthy, and when I left a note for the maid to please change the blanket, she merely turned it over. Lighting in the bathroom was so dim hard to see to put on make up and no other mirror in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good Hotel with dome deficits”
Reviews.Author: TobiasML
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late in the evening. We could not get a reservation for my colleague at the Hotel for the same night as they had been fully booked. We had to go on this trip on short notice. The hotel staff had been very helpful and they managed to provide us with a room despite the fact that they have been fully booked. They did not wanted to rent it out as the mirror was broken. Anyway we were glad to get a room for him. The hotel is quite nice, every morning we had a wide range of newspapers in the lobby. The rooms itself are very small. The bed is occupying about 90% of the room. I had difficulties to find a place to open my suitcase. The bathroom was ok. Nothing special but enough room. Therefore efficient. I have been missing the remote control as well as the wireless internet. According to the staff they have been upgrading the system. This was the only real disappointment. But it was compensated by the free wireless access in the restaurant. The restaurant (Cafe Paradiso) within the hotel has very good food. At the first night we had ordered a burger and a club sandwich. Despite the late hour, the burger and the sandwich was fresh and the quality was very good. The staff very friendly and niice. The hotel itself is located directly in center of the city. Walking distance to the major attraction. Opposite the entrance is the monorail station which is even more convenient. This hotel is not great for parking, if you want to have your own car around. Parking is only possible at the shopping mall which is 2 blocks away. I guess this is the downside of being in the center of the city. Overall I would say it is good for a short stay or for budget purposes. For longer stays or vacations I would consider other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, but small rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: JKAuckland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a standard Queen room. The Metro is ideal for an overnight stay as it is very handy to the Train station ion the central city. Rooms are very small but clean and tidy. Staff are attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hammie2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a very good location, with ~ 5mins walk to the Town Hall rail station and monorail stations. a good 20mins walk and you are in chinatown / darling harbour. There were a few convenience shops, restaurants or fast food outlets near the hotel as well (7-11 is less than 5 mins walk away) The room which we stayed in was quite spacious and there were even complimentary newspapers (daily telegraph or sunday morning herald) every day. Our room was situated at the far back of the hotel (away from the monorail track). as it was a standard room. I also like the security feature where we need to slot in our access card in the lift before we can actually go to the level of our room. However, WIFI wasn't free and we had to purchase a drink / meal prior to logging onto the internet using the password provided. in addition, the housekeeping wasn't really up to the standard where some of the items were not replenished / washed. Moreover, the rooms weren't 100% soundproof. All in all, i think what I liked best about the hotel was it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yakiudon
Reviews.Content: I booked the queen deluxe and was happy on arrival to be upgraded to a King Spa. I made a note to get a room on a higher level (away from the monorail) and was on the top level 7. The king spa room was very nice, everything was clean and looked great. The curtains are nice and thick which can totally block out light from the outside, which perfectly suited our sleep in. The bathroom was again nice and clean, although the 'spa' was actually a small bath with a few jets. There was a CD player but no DVD player. The receptionist was there when we returned at 2am on a Tuesday night which was surprising. The location itself is great, around the corner from the train station, food, shopping and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, adequate budget hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: The hotel promotes itself as 4 star but it is more like 3 star. My room was on the 2nd floor, no view, a small room; bed, small bedside table, tv on the wall, tea and coffee, small, narrow desk and chair; nothing else and no space for anything else. was. The bathroom was surprisingly big given the small size of the room. Maybe some other rooms were bigger than mine. The bedding was all fine. The whole hotel is non-smoking which is a plus. There is a modern looking restaurant downstairs but no room service. The location is excellent, very central, 2 blocks from Town Hall station, and an easy walk to Pitt St mall, Hyde Park or Chinatown. It is not a room which you would want to spend much time but I only paid $128 so it's good value for a budget hotel in an excellent location. It is fine for a short work trip but I wouldn't come back to stay for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: OzAsh7614
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an anniversary in the King Spa Suite with the addition of the Romance package that included Wine, Chocolates and a 1 hr later checkout. The room was average size with a spa bath that could only fit 1 person comfortably. The chocolates were lovely but the wine was disgusting and cheap. Our refrigerator was set too low and took a fair while to decrease in temp so we requested a bucket of ice TWICE and still took 20 minutes to arrive after the reminder. For the overall price I paid it certainly was not worth it. I have since emailed my feedback to several email addresses located on the hotel website and am yet to receive a response.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual hotel”
Reviews.Author: thatsgreatforme
Reviews.Content: I had a very strange room which was designed around wheel chair access. This meant the bathroom was very large but the actual bedroom wasn't. The view from the window was of another room and the fixtures and fittings were in need of some refurbishment. The location was good but be aware there is a sister hotel 100m further down on Pitt St. so make sure your taxi driver knows which one you are going to.

Reviews.Title: “Great for shops- location”
Reviews.Author: marie206
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a very pleasant stay at this Hotel. The room was small but we were only there to sleep so it didn't worry us. The Staff were very pleasant and accommodating, and everything was clean and tidy. The location to the shops is brilliant, just a quick walk to everything, even darling harbour , and the rocks a bit further but walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Straight forward cheap hotel in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: illucid
Reviews.Content: The Metro on Pitt is a straight forward hotel. No real thrills to it. The room was smaller than I thought it'd be but then I wasn't really in Sydney to stay in my hotel room so I didn't mind. Good location not far from Central station. Just be careful walking up, you'll see the other Metro first a d might get confused. (glad I read a previous review which mentioned it, otherwise I'm sure I would have mixed them up.) There's nothing to rave about with this hotel but there's also nothing wrong with it. A good night sleep in a decent room for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Jobell66
Reviews.Content: Was quite surprised at this hotel after reading many reviews. Metro on Pitt is in a good location close to shops and train station. The room was modern, clean and the bathroom was spacious for a hotel room. Our one complaint was that the monorail passed at our room level every 15 minutes but stopped around 10.30 pm. Good value for money for a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: cesarhanke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to our compny's office in Sydney but it always have higher prices that the other hotels I am used to stay. Yesterday I stayed there and because it is usually more expensive I was hoping it was a lot better. My mistake, the hotel room was tiny, had no LCD tv but an old small CRT tv. Cleanliness could be improved as well. Also in the morning we could smell vapours of food being cooked in the kitchen... not very pleasant way to wake up. On the other hand, aircond was good, bathroom was good to, and staff was very nice. I believe travelodge and vibe hotel are much better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in the Heart of the City for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: nrn218
Reviews.Content: Centralised booking on line was really user friendly compared to several other Hotel booking sites. Room tariff is very reasonable for a Hotel in such a prime location in the City Centre. Well connected by all means of publil transport system. Just across is car rentals such as Avis. Walkable distance to metro station and several tourist attractions including Darling Harbour. China Town is just a stone throw distance. Close to nice shopping for branded as well as cheap Chinese stuff. Compact business centre to use computers and check mails for those who do not carry a laptop. Rooms are clean, compact with a large bathroom. Friendly staff at the Hotel and 24 Hrs security makes this my first preference to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemfish
Reviews.Content: Once again having used TripAdvisor to find accomodation, the site proved its worth. This hotel in central Sydney is near to all the things we wanted to do and see during our two day visit. Check in was simple, having parked directly opposite the hotel to unload the baggage, my partner then drove to the suggested car park where the car was garaged for the duration of the day at cost of $28 per day payable on check out to the hotel. Our room located on the second floor did overlook the monorail but the noise from this was not intrusive as it did not run through the night. The room including the bathroom was very clean and had great decor, quality modern furnishings an LCD television, tea and coffee making facility and provisions. The second morning we chose to eat breakfast in the cafe adjacent to the lobby. For just over $20 we were served a most delicious cooked breakfast together with coffee. There was nothing more we could have wanted in this hotel apart from a cheaper rate but hey this is central Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “A choice budget hotel in the heart of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: debsopinion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location in the heart of the CBD on Pitt Street (near the corner of Pitt & Bathurst Streets) great if your wanting to do a spot of shopping as the main mall area is only 2 blocks plus close to the Queen Victoria Building and the George Street Cinemas. Also close to major supermarket, Woolworths if you need to pick up any groceries. The rooms are very small - smaller than a normal hotel room. But for the price point, they are clean & comfortable and the staff there are fantastic. Only suggestion to other people wanting to book this hotel is to request NOT to be placed on 2nd floor at the front of the building as the Sydney monorail runs (literally) right past your window for most of the hours of the day which is pretty annoying. The restaurant, Paradiso is pretty crap and expensive. For the prices they charge you would be better off wandering around Sydney looking for another place which would be better quality and cheaper. The restaurant is kind of dark and dingy too. All in all, a no frills hotel but great for a budget choice for a Sydney stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dubc100
Reviews.Content: Great location! Rooms do not have a view though. But the hotel service was great! We checked in very early and they happily accommodated us. Hotel is close to any and everything! Had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful Hotel in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanypurple
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel two nights whilst in Sydney in March 2010. The location was perfect. On Pitt Street, close to subway and easy to reach by car/cab. The staff were friendly and I was able to check in early which was fantastic. The room was basic but good value for money for so Central in Sydney. The view wasn't amazing but then I wasn't paying for that. I just wanted someone clean and quiet to stay and it did the job. One tip I did read which is definitely worth taking note of is the breakfast. Definitely don't pay for breakfast at the cafe in the lobby as it is overpriced. If you walk 100 yards down the road there are several other cafes at half the price. Great hotel if you want something clean and basic.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox in a great location”
Reviews.Author: urameatball
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel suitable for people on a budget. Got a Queen room and it the room was just big enough to fit a queen bed and 2 suitcases. The TV was small and flickered to the point where it would give you a headache. The desk was big enough for you to put a purse a cellphone, and that's it. Bathroom had a stand-up shower only. It's designed to meet all your basic needs to be semi-comfortable, and nothing more. If your intention of booking a hotel is to find a place to shower and sleep, and be in Sydney central, this is it. But if you actually plan on being able to relax in your room, find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: summer005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on arrival to Sydney from Ireland. We arrived early at 9am and explained that we had been travelling for two days. Receptionist was very unhelpful. He stated room would not be available until the check in time stated. Exhausted we decided to walk around Sydney until our room was ready. We were able to store our bags. We arrived back to the hotel about 12pm and decided to just wait in the lobby. Many other people came in and checked in with no problem but the receptionist still stated our room was not ready. We had stated when booking that we would be arriving early. I realise they can not suit all requests but the attitude really annoyed me. Eventually at 2pm we were able to check in. Again the receptionist was unhelpful. He seemed put out when we asked for a map and some directions. They seem to be very understaffed. The room was average. Bathroom was small. Seemed quite old. Tiles cracked around bath. Also two cockroaches in the bathroom. Seemed to be coming from the drain in the centre of the floor. Eventually covered it and that did the trick. The pool on the roof is nice. The key card needs to be set so you can access it from the lift. Hot tub not working. Overall, good location but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “okay but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: adelaidekobe
Reviews.Content: stayed there over new years eve biggest minus: couldn't open windows, no balkony and the worst view (just looked at 3 walls) no call to the people to either put the towels on the floor if fresh ones are requierd or not (towels were changed every day, too often in my opinion) my friend arrived from overseas at 08.00 am, check in was at 11.00, no bathroom where she could have had a shower to make herself more comfortable after a long flight, no coffee was offered or anything like that... great location, pretty clean

Reviews.Title: “decent NYE stay ....”
Reviews.Author: icedaddyuk
Reviews.Content: We upgraded room for $30 a night on arrival to a deluxe room. The room was nice enough but I wouldn't want to see the smaller room we upgraded from! Nice shower and towels, LCD TV. 10-15 minute walk to circular key (opera house etc) and 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gaily09
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. I was very pleased with the accomodations. The front office staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and tidy. The only drawback to the room was the window looked out on the building next door. No sunlight in the room making it darker and a bit closed in. Quiet room even though my room was right by the elevator. Great location if wanting to tour Sydney. I walked to all the popular sites from this hotel. Easiest way to get to this hotel from the Sydney airport is to use the Airport Connect shuttle bus. Only $12 one way. If you need to use a computer, don't use the computer they provide. Way too expensive. There is a little internet cafe almost right across the street and the rate was $1.50 for 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; monorail noise”
Reviews.Author: KellieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 night in Nov, it is like a boutique hotel, location is great, not senic but closed to everything, walking distance to darling harbour (cockle bay etc), the rocks & circ quay, china town any where you would want to go. Monorail stop just outside and 2 stations very close by. Room was small and neat, staff where friendly, can get a shuttle to and from the airport for $12.00 (taxi cost us $40). The onyl problem was we had a room right on Pitt street and the noise from the monorail started before 9, so if you are looking for a sleep in ask for a room at the back. The cafe downstairs makes great coffee but the breaky was ordinary.. Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: kiminc
Reviews.Content: The room condition wasn't satisfactory. my bed was faulty and i requested for a change on the first night. but after all my 3 nights there, the bed is still not changed. The breakfast also quite bad.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: lauren_d8
Reviews.Content: Apart from the confusion of finding this place (considering there are two) the place was rather nice. It is only really appropriate for short stays I would think as there isnt a lot of room to move about. Having said that though, it is a nice place to stay. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: goodstuff
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Service: Staff was very helpful. When we arrived early our room was not ready. We left our luggage and went out. When we returned, our luggage had been placed in the room already. Also, because we added 2 days to our stay (for a total of 8 days) they upgraded our room. A very nice surprise. Room: Very nice and spacious, Bathroom was very nicely appointed with a large shower stall. Could use more drawers for clothes, however. Location: Couldn't be better. One block from George St, and the Town Hall station. A nice walk, if you like to walk, to Darling Harbour, The Rocks, etc. Tips: You can get free WiFi in the adjoining breakfast room/restaurant. And once you have the sign-in code, you can get the free WiFi in the lobby too. It costs $25/day in the room. We bought juice, fruit, yogurt, etc at the nearby Woolworths supermarket a block away and kept these in the fridge in the room for light breakfasts and snack. All in all, this was an excellent value and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing, shabby”
Reviews.Author: lwhit50
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Metro which is on the edge of Chinatown opposite capitol Theatre. Location is ok but a walk neede to better area for eateries e.g top end of Geeoge street (try Scenario) Can use the free CBD bus 55 to get around or monorail close by for Rocks, Darling Harbour, Opera House Hyde Park Our booking was for a queen size room on floor 9 - 12 We were shown a very small room with a double bed on a lower floor at the very end of a corridor. It had a brick wall outside it. POn seeing the hotel we asked to see the room before we paid the bill. You are expected to pay all up front and give a credit card imprint ( a practice we do not like because of possible fraud) We were shown another room with 2 single beds which was brighter and larger. We were told take it or leave it we do not have another by a curt female member of staff. We were annoyed as had booked months before but did not feel we had any option. We paid half the bill and gave cahs for a bond. The rooms air conditioning did not work and it was stuck on a very cold temperature. Maintenance could not fix it. The televsion reception was appallling and again they could not fix it. The television was removed with a promise of another the neext day This did not happen. A third television was brought after complaint and it did not work either A new cable was tried and still it did not work so we were asked to move rooms . Thjis was inconvenient as wewe were going out for the evening and we ended up moving rooms at 11 pm The 3rd rom was probably more like what was on our booking. We got some refund. This hotel is shabby .The renovations patchy Some furnishing has been done and bedding and towels are good Shower areas leave something to be desired. The basin had been painted over and the origonal purple paint was showing. It was also very noisy. Eevery night there were people banging and shouting in corridors and walls are thin between rooms. The young men on the desk were very helpful with directions and information but the women were not. We would not stay there again. We have stayed in much better in Sydney for similar money.

Reviews.Title: “Good 5Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwoz2
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (8.30am) and were given a room, so things got off to a great start. Our room was as shown in the photos. We stayed in a Superior Deluxe. Close to the Free bus, Town Hall Station and the mono rail. Great bed and lovely white fluffy towels. Very clean and quiet even tho you're right in Pitt Street, the windows were double glazed so that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leelou28
Reviews.Content: I went to the Metro with pretty low expectations considering the previous mixed reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. We paid $320 for 2 nights which I thought was pretty cheap and had a nice room with everything you could need. There was no view and the room did lack a bit of natural light but as we were sightseeing a lot it didn't really matter.The room was clean, the beds comfortable and the bathroom clean & tidy as well. It was also very quiet which I really appreciated as some of the apartments I've stayed in Sydney before have no sound proofing and you hear the traffic all night. The location was great being right in the middle of the CBD and a short walk to most attractions, and the staff at reception were good to deal with and quite helpful. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Metro is suffice for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: koko638
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 Refurbished queen rooms for 1 Saturday night. The rooms were spacious and exactly like the pictures on their website.. except the bathroom which was not Refurbished. It had an old bath tub with shower curtains and dispensers for shampoo, conditioner and body wash.. i'd never thought I'd see this in a 'hotel' but more like a 'hostel'. My friends in the other room complained that there was minimal hot water and the shower head was squirting water everywhere. Additionally, there was no control panel in the room to change the temperature. The airconditioning and heating is centrally controlled and was too cold. But the location is super! Close to everything we needed. This would be a better hotel if they had refurbished the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A very average stay.”
Reviews.Author: Emj12
Reviews.Content: Location - only at 20 minute walk to the Ferry Point which was quite handy. Hotel seemed understaffed - We had to wait at least 25 minutes to check in as there was only one person on a very busy reception desk& I also waited for 35 minutes to eventually recieve our luggage that they had kept in the luggage room at the end of our stay. The 'superior' Suite we stayed in was very small and the view from the window was simply the brick wall of another hotel. The bathroom was standard. I wouldnt recommend the $21 buffet breakfast - very little choice& quite pricey for the quality of the food served (the peanut butter sachets were also 3 months out of date). Would probably chose to stay somewhere else next time we visit Sydney as value for money wasn't brilliant here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CCQ01
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel since it had pretty good reviews at a reasonable price and it was very close to the Metro Theatre where I was going to see a band. The room was perfectly adequate for our short stay. Very clean room and bathroom. Comfortable queen size bed. The staff were friendly. When we had a bit of a problem with our TV, someone came up to fix it straight away. Only a few blocks from great shopping such as the Queen Victoria Building and about a 10-15 minute walk to Darling Harbour. Chinatown is also only a short walk away. Great view of the monorail going past our window!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fanny_sh19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a trip of a lifetime and thought generally it was a very good hotel. Loacted about a 10 min walk from Darling Harbour and far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be able to get a good nights sleep! We only paid 15 pound each a ight which was the same price as some of the hostels! To get to the main parts of Sydney eg the Opera House etc you need to gt on a boat but they leave reguarly rom the Darling Harbour and only takes about 15 mins on the boat. Fairly quiet hotel although most nights the asian couple in the room next door kept us awake with their nocturnal love making! No kitchen facilites in room or bar baut snacks and alcoho available from vending macines in the lobby! Reception keep your passports as a deposit which initially worried me but really was not a problem. Train station was only a few mins walk away with easy access to all locations including the blue mountains which really is an essential trip. Breakfast not included but plently of places locally to eat out. Most restaurants seemed to be chinese! I would stay here again next time I visit Sydney and there is so much to do and see. We stayed for 1 week but it was not nearly long enough!

Reviews.Title: “No more than average, could be so much better.”
Reviews.Author: S D Evs
Reviews.Content: Had a couple of nights here in mid February as part of a large group. The room I shared was very small and there was no place to put our suitcases. The staff were very vague and some spoke poor English. This hotel is in Chinatown and it is geared towards the Chinese/Japanese, all the reception staff were of far east descent and most of our group felt as if we were an afterthought. The breakfast was very ordinary and I complained about the quality to the duty manager, needless to say it did not improve. Shame really because the hotel enjoys a great location, we will not return unless I hear of an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Metro Hotel on Pitt”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Ani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metro Hotel by myself, as a sole traveller under 25. My room was clean and comfortable and I was able to check in when I arrived in Sydney. The room had enough facilities to be able to enjoy my nights in. I found the reception staff to be cheerful, friendly and helpful, always answering questions and helping me out when I couldn't figure out how to use the wireless internet! The restaurnat staff were also very friendly, inviting me in to sit in the restaurant because I would be more comfortable using my laptop in there. Overall, this was probably my best ever hotel experience and I happily refer people to the Metro on Pitt whenever they tell me they'll be staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rich1974
Reviews.Content: I write this review to give you all some accurate advice for this property. I have stayed in a number of hotels and usually opt for 4.5-5 star properties but as i live in Sydney i just wanted something for me and my new wife to enjoy a quiet night together. Before i chose my accommodation i looked up some properites in wotif.com. Once i decided on a property i liked i looked up their website and chose the best 3 properties for me to consider (this time around i chose properties for both value and comfort when i usually go by Trip Advisor recommendations). At end of my research i chose the Metro Hotel on Pitt due to the fact the room i chose (Superior Deluxe Queen) looked very comfortable and modern (i was told they had been recently rennovated). As i was on their website i decided to book my accomodation at that time. Booking was easy and the rate was very affordable. NOTE: I always research my hotels in depth. This way i know what they offer and i am not sprung and surprises when i get there. This take a bit of time but it always helps in the long run. Read bout a hotel by its website before you choose it. If a Travel Agent recommends a hotel i still suggest you look it up first. The day before we were due to check in i called reservations to confirm everything was ok and sure eniough it was. They were very helpful with my questions regarding parking directions (none available on site) and other things that i needed to bring along. Check in went extremely well. I dont believe a word of what those other people said about this hotels staff not being helpful. Each staff member i spoke to was more than happy to help and always smiled. I even had a good laugh with the check in receptionist and it certainly helped me feel at ease. The hotel restaurant is small but very quaint. We stopped off for a drink before heading off to our dinner in Darling Harbour (a short 10 minute walk). The bar manager was very friendly and funny which put us in a good mood for dinner. Check out was easy and again the morning staff (or afternoon by the time we left) were very friendly. They stored our bags as my wife wanted to punish me with some shopping at Pitt Street Mall (5 minutes walk from the hotel). Once we collected our bags the porter walked us out and gave us directions back to the parking building (parking was only $25.00!! I have spend over $35.00 ++ at some hotels). Overall a great experience! I have family coming over from NZ all the time and i will be putting them up at this hotel no worries! I must admit some reviews were a bit of a worry but i always say that there is only ever one review that really counts..........YOUR'S! Come give this hotel a try. I do reccommend the Superior Deluxe rooms (although i see they have a King Spa room which looks pretty nice as well :-)

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay in my hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Hephaestus
Reviews.Content: This is just the first day that I book into this hotel and I already feel that this is going to be my worst hotel stay ever. I feel that the service of the reception of this hotel is real terrible. I suspect even to a certain degree that the staff is racist as I am a Chinese. When I book into the hotel and enquire about the parking as they don't have a parking in the hotel. The staff direct me to the parking 2 streets away that the hotel have a contract with for cheaper parking rate. When asking for the exact direction and what to look out for to know that it's the right car park, he answered in an impatient tone like I am some moron who don't even understand simple instructions. And only after much attempt, then I realize that he's referring to the world square parking. After checked into the room, we found the blue button (to watch the movie) and the on/off button of the remote not working. When we told the reception that the remote on/off is not working, he told us we have to wait till tomorrow. But when we inform him that the blue button is not working, he told us he will come up to take a look. The whole process of coming up took him 10-15 min. After checking the system, he told us that we have to wait for tomorrow then he can get someone to take a look so we cannot watch movie for the night. So we told him to get us an internet access and what are the package available. He told us there's a 24 hours package for 29 AUD. We thought that's the longest package available and thus we opt for it. But only when we connected to the hotel internet website, then we realized that there's actually a 3 days package for 44 AUD. We had not entered our password to activate the package, so we call him to enquire about changing or upgrading the package to the 3 days package. He told us that he had already charged the 1 day package to us and cannot be undone. I am a system analyst. I don't believe there's any system designer stupid enough to design a billing system without a reversal process or functionality. I also believe not company is moron enough to buy such a system that if they bill wrongly, they cannot reverse the billing and redo it. I believe he's just plain lazy and lack of good customer service to go the extra miles to do this for us or maybe he's paid commission based on what he billed us. I don't know his name but the reception that gave me such a bad experience is the guy on duty on 19 Dec 2008 10pm (sydney time).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: rhyd78
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was ok but a few things let the whole place down. Firstly the staff weren't that helpful, got the impression that they dealt with a lot of troublesome travellers and so anyone aged under 30 wasn't worth bothering with. The bar was poor and closed incredibly early although with one of the world's great city's on the doorstop, this was hardly a problem. Not the worst hotel in the world by a long way but probably much better to be had in Sydney for the price.

Reviews.Title: “my home in sydney!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diannecaldwell
Reviews.Content: i stay at metro on pitt whenever in sydney......like about six times a year......for the last four years......over that period of time i have not one complaint......friendly...clean...a location to die for.....and nothing is to much trouble for the staff.....if i cant stay at metro i dont go...as everything else is overpriced.....love the small hotel as opposed to big and glitzy and expensive....thank you metro.....di caldwell......canberra.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rate, Nice room”
Reviews.Author: lighthouseboy
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a queen superior for $149 AUD. American Airlines had a quoted rate for government employee (Australian/NZ govt worker) and emailed the hotel that I was an US govt worker on vacation and they extended the rate. I was in Room 301 (or 310) which faced Pitt St and the monorail. The monorail never bothered me. I like the area around the hotel (Albert Park, Town Hall area, Pitt St Mall) and there were plenty of places to eat or to get some to take away. Like all the other Australian and NZ hotels I have stay at, it had a small fridge. So, I did get a small thing of milk and some sodas to store. Hotel give me a free 1/2 litre of water each day along with a paper. Room was big and bed was comfortable and had a nice TV with like ten stations (as an American, I am so spoiled in getting 50+ channels at American hotels!). Bathroom had plently of hot water and the shower had a wall unit with shampoo, conditioner and body gel. By the sink, was a dispender of soap, lotion and shaving cream! Towels were ok (wish they were fluffier). I have no problem staying here again if I got a queen room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: acnova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metro Hotel on Pitt during the last week or so of February. Good points: -Location is good. Right in the middle of the CBD. About a ten-fifteen minute walk to Oxford Street, Circular Quay, and Darlington Harbour. -Service was good, depending on who is at the desk. The guy during the day is not pleasant, but the women who work the later shift and in the morning are quite friendly and helpful. Bad point: -The budget room is tiny. Not even European tiny, maybe like Japanese tiny. Only go for the budget room if you are travelling alone. Overall an okay room for the budget-minded single traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small room”
Reviews.Author: gatorhon
Reviews.Content: It's a good thing we stayed for one night, before we left Sydney. I knew the rooms were small since I had read the reviews, but it was amusing with all of our luggage in the room and no where to move. We arrived around 11 a.m. and our room wasn't ready so they held our bags. When we arrived back after 2 p.m. they had already moved our bags to our room. I was grossed out by the trash can in the bathroom (the only one) with some unknown substance (blood perhaps?) moved the lid and put it on the floor. I also noticed some makeup (not mine) on the wall between the sink and the toilet. The bed was tiny and not comfortable either. Otherwise, everything else was fine for one night and it was a great location. The shower was large and had built-in dispensers for shampoo, conditioner and bath gel. They also had shaving cream in a dispense by the sink. On the day of checkout we had some extra time so we wandered around Sydney one last time and they held our bags for us. Everyone was pleasant and the hotel seemed nice overall, but the room was small and not 100% clean.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Man_U_canuck
Reviews.Content: Ok, the location was great, only 5 mins walk from the Town Hall Station and easy to find, but the service was terrible and the room was small!
