I checked in at noon and they said the room wasn't ready so i left my luggages with them. I went back there at 2 and they just threw me the key and said room's ready, you can go now. And i showed them my luggage tag and they said you bags are in the room already. So i was ful of joy running to the room. I opened the door, the room was so dull and small, and the bags weren't in the room, so I called '9' for the receiption. I said 'Hi, I was just wondering.......' then she cut in and said 'yes 513, you bags are on the way, thank you'. Like...can't you just let me finish my sentance? So the bell boy came appox 5 mins later with bags, which weren't mine. I said well those aren't mine he said oh really, ARE YOU SURE. WHAT! You think I'm blind or what? I descriped the bags then he left. 5 mins later he actually CALLED me and said I can't find your bags can you come down and see which ones are yours. I said I can give you my tag number, he said it won't be useful just come down please. I told him i'm so tired and I can't be bothered going down. He actually said well i have no idea which bags are yours since there are so many of them here. Well, yeh, I went down and spot my bags right away. I can't believe that. What's the use of the tag then if you don't have a system to store bags! Goodness me! The room looked dirty, i can see stains on the bed sheets (eww), the bathroom smells actually. The in room dining menu was a joke, it's just a printout from Microsoft Word, and stapled together. Couldn't bother going out for dinner that night so I ordered room service - scallops with asparagus and blah blah. They came up with my food, and took off the lid and i saw squid, but not scallops, and she was like...oh i didn't know, i'll go and change that for you now. turned out they've punched in the wrong order! Don't even bother to try the breakfast, not much variety to choose from and don't taste good.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: eireblue
Reviews.Content: Nov 2007 - Needed to stay for one night in Sydney before travelling on so found the best rate for this hotel at hotel.com. Very pleased with location which was in the centre of Sydney near CBD. Staff were friendly and helpful whilst the room was nice and clean with plenty of amenties provided. Although the room was not overly huge it was more than adequate for our stay with a good sized bathroom. There was a view into the well of the hotel but then we did not book this hotel for the view! As we arrived late we were not too hungry so found a Woolworth's (similar to Tesco in UK) where we bought ourselves some rolls and snacks whilst a little way along the road we found a bottle shop where you purchase beer/wine etc. At this time (9pm) there were plenty of beggars to be found on the streets. However, there appeared to be just as many the next morning but this is not unique to this area. It is fascinating to find that often they are better dressed than you are! In the morning turned right out of hotel and crossed the road to find a small, clean and effecient eatery called the Flame Grill where I had poached eggs on toast + coffee whilst my husband had scrambled eggs on toast + coffee - excellent and all for AUS$13.80!! One word of warning:.......................... taxi drivers do not like short journeys so when we alighted from ferry at Circular Quay and asked taxi to take us to Metro on Pitt - we were told \9after we had begun our journey) that there was no such hotel and we were wrong only to find after driving around and the meter now showing over AUS$12.50 (should have been only around AUS$5) hey presto, here was the Metro on Pitt street! Not impressed at all with the arrogance and blatant rudeness of the driver. Would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: DaisyWicklow
Reviews.Content: THis hotel is only two blocks (5 minutes) from Darling Harbour and 4 blocks (10 minutes) from Circular Quay. Hyde park is one block and the skytrain is practically outside the door. The bedroom was a bit small but the ensuite makes up for this being quite large. We had a lovely meal in the hotel restaurant which was reasonably priced but were disappointed with the breakfast, which was not good value for money. Across the street is Mona's cafe where you can get an all day breakfast for $7.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Elgreco00mi
Reviews.Content: Nice location, can walk to Darling Harbour and Circular Key, did not take the subway although I understand it is very close. Many restaurants and shopping nearby, hotel was clean and reception check me in and out very efficiently. Not the largest room but I was only there to sleep and perhaps rest between excursions. Sydney is such a wonderful town, every time I walk to a habour I found another set of restaurants and bars to explore. I found the location to be very central and safe, and also close are several 7 11's for small items. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: MissJaneM
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here after finding a deal on the web for under $110 per night. This is a good price for a fairly central hotel in Sydney! Of course, it was the basic double room, so it was fairly no frills, and the rooms are very small. There are no views to speak of either. If you want loads of room, or lovely views in Sydney, like London, you pay a lot more. Our room was very comfortable, nicely furnished in a modern style, and very quiet. The bathroom was very clean, and the whole hotel very nicely decorated. The Metro on Pitt is situated only 2 blocks down (toward the central railway station) from the Pitt St. mall. The bar/restaurant on the ground floor has a good and inexpensive (again, for Sydney) menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I would stay here again, as it was clean, quiet, attractive, inexpensive and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kabwe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at another one of their properties for a wedding earlier in the year. So I gave this one a crack as it had breakfast in the rate and was a great price for Pitt St right in the heart of Sydney and walking distance from my conference. On the good side. Checked in at 1am and it was really easy, room was good for the price and the quality of the bed and pillows was great they seemed new and I loved the free bottled water. Bathroom was clean and functional, check out was easy, the staff were friendly and there was an internet connector (forgot my cable). On the not so goodside. The slow slow lift and breakfast room which didnt really fit in context of the hotel although the breakfast was fine. How ever this was more than made up for by the location. You could walk any where in down town Sydney from here. Every taxi driver can find it, there is rail, mono rail and bus outside the door. So for its price and its location i liked it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location..”
Reviews.Author: travelleralamundo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metro for 5 nights. Previous reviews are pretty accurate of the experience you would encounter at this hotel. This is a boutique hotel. By US standards, the rooms are about half the size of a typical 3 star US hotel . I had a room with a queen bed, office desk and two seat sofa. Luggage space is very limited, I stored my bags on the sofa. The bathrooms were nice and clean as was the shower stall. The rooms and the bathroom could do with a little more lighting. The rooms are well appointed, albeit there was some patchwork on some of the walls, no worries....The mini fridge in the room came in handy to store items. Coffee and tea are complimentary and plentiful. I did not use the hotel restaurant as there are many to chose from outside the hotel but it certainly looked nice. Internet.. Metro charges $5 for half an hour, exit the hotel on the left, walk a block and there is an internet cafe across the street, charging $1 per hr with print capabilities. All in all, this is great little hotel, very convenient to major attractions and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a great choice if your on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: dannii52
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March of this year, and had no problems whatsoever. The location is fine, the room was nice and clean with plenty of room and the staff were very polite. The hotel is a great choice if your on a budget. It is easy to get from the airport too, we just caught the subway and walked 2 blocks. Its also a short walk to paddys market from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: chuckerby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was ok for a city hotel. Room was badly designed with no storage space and hence we had a constant juggle of suitcases and bags to deal with! Thought the room was clean until I spilt some water on the bedside table and had to mop it up - my towel was a disgusting colour! Breakfast was dire and in the hotel bar! Only good thing about this was the location: 10 mins from Central Station and 15 mins from the bridge. You could definitely stay somewhere better for similar money.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Brucie243
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. We stayed 4 nights in all, 3 at the beginning of our holiday and 1 at the end. We arrived very early (7am) having flown from Singapore and much to our surprise and relief they got us a room ready within an hour. All the staff we met were very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are well designed, quiet and everything spotless. We had a deluxe room for our first stay and standard for the last night. The standard was smaller but still plenty big enough. There is a cafe on the ground floor (Paradiso) which is a separate business but very convenient and does a good buffet breakfast and other meals. The location is great, very close to Hyde Park and about 25 mins walking distance from Circular Quay and 10 mins from Darling Harbour. Altogether we would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a smallish friendly place with every convenience and in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: honolulutraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to a great pedestrian mall, chinatown and an abundance of restaurants and shops. The hotel is old but nicely renovated. The staff was friendly and courteous. The rooms are small but ok for a party of two. The shower was kind of dirty upon arrival with mold around the drain. The room had no view except for the busy street below. Surprisingly, the room was very quiet. The area seemed very safe. We walked around the area late at night and early in the morning with no problems. It was about two blocks to the nearest subway station. Overall a great value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Airco system very loud”
Reviews.Author: Csakzsu
Reviews.Content: Positive remarks: The location is really convenient. The size of the room was ok, nothing special. Negative: The air ventillation system was very lound . I had even a flu so we asked at the reception to stop airventilation, but they could not do anything. They offered us a good deal :) (I still have to laugh)They can do an upgrade if we pay more, but they cannot guarantee that the air-ventilation won"t be that noisy. I would only go back if they change this centrally controlled system.

Reviews.Title: “Not Overly Happy”
Reviews.Author: missdez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metro after spending a week in Hamilton Island. Our problem's started with the Metro before we even got there. We had booked 3 months in advance through a manager who was on duty at the time and she gave us a special deal as we were booking 2 rooms. It turned out this Manager didn't even work there anymore and when rang up to organise child minding so we could go to the casino one night they couldn't find our booking. It took 4 different people and finally they gave up and said they would take the booking there and then. But not at the rate quoted. Finally after arguing for ages they gave us the originally rate. Then i was advised they didn't even have child minding facilities and I must of been misinformed, even though it states it on their own website. Not to worry. We checked in fine. The hotel seemed to be clean. Although we had payed more to upgrade our rooms we found out later that all the rooms were the same throughout the hotel, after speaking with them they advised us we couldnt have our extra $15 charge back a night because our room was on a higher floor. WOW!! So anyway we dropped our stuff and headed off. Great thing about this hotel is the location, close to tonnes of pubs, restaurants, public transport its awesome. Later that night we returned to go to bed, layed on the bed AND IT BROKE!! So AGAIN we were on the phone to reception who said they would have someone up. An hour later still noone so we rang again they said someone was on the way. It was 2am before someone finally arrives and all he did was throw the mattress on the floor and said they will deal with it the next day. Since we were so buggered we just went to sleep. Next night when we came back to the hotel the room was still the same. Bed on the floor. We rang reception to see if it was going to be fixed and they said they had no record of us ringing it through *Sighs* So anyway apparently the french lady on the phone said noone was able to do anything til a manager returned in the morning. Again we slept on the floor. I dunno about you but i reckon you can find a park bench a lot cheaper and comfortable for less than $145. The next day they finally decided to move our rooms. But instead of taking our luggage for us, or the portacot which was supplied, they expected us to do it ourselves. Our next room was exactly the same. Only in this room the toilet never flushed and the heating/air con never worked. *Sighs* Our last problem happened at checkout. We had gotten breakfast each day as an extra. We asked just for two adults each day even though we have a 1yr old. Upon paying the bill we questioned the 3 breakfasts daily. They had charged us for our son's breakfast even though he had weetbix and formula milk for breakfast WHICH WE SUPPLIED OURSELVES. We didn't even use their cutlery. He normally had his breakfast in the room before we had ours. To much of our disgust, they refused to waive the charges even though a waitress confirmed he never eat the breakfasts. Finally in a huff we left. Problems however didn't stop there. We left for melbourne on a sunday and it was wednesday after we were home i went to pay some bills with my credit card we had used for checkout from the hotel and i was in shock when i found it declined. i quickly rang my bank and they said i was overdrawn. She read out the last transactions. THE HOTEL HAD CHARGED ME NOT ONCE, NOT TWICE, BUT THREE TIMES!!!! They had charged me for the other room that i had my partner's parents staying in even though they paid for their room, and they then charged me another lot. After ringing the hotel back and demanding there money they now refuse to give it back so i have to wait a darn 45 days til my bank reverses the payments. would i go back there?? xxxx NO!! GOOD POINTS - Just up around the corner and paddy maguires they offer $5 dinner meals that are the bomb Across the road the cocktail bar has cheap deals throughout the week. The asian place across the road serves awesome food.

Reviews.Title: “as described by other travellers in tripadvisor, thanks !”
Reviews.Author: figarochouchou
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this hotel : clean, comfortable, convenient and their staff very helpful. The only incomprehensible part is their short or lack of closet for hanging clothes. I really don't understand their drawer of wine glasses in favor of more hanging space (lengthwise). Still, I would recommend the hotel to other travellers, it is between Chinatown and the business/shopping districts, also a nice acceptable walking distance to the ports. I enjoyed my stay in Sydney, mostly because of the comfort of the hotel. The staff (housekeeping) has been most understanding for my request of "more milk" : 20 little cuplets per day. Plus, there is a dry cleaning/laudry outfit next door (same day service), which made my shopping and wearing my new clothes so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Got everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: Donno
Reviews.Content: In ideal position for the city. Close to monorail stop for ease of access to Darling Harbour or Central although this is walkable. Best walk down, not up! Rooms are well equipped including glasses for wine, bottle openers, coffee, tea etc. No view at all from the rooms. Don't buy breakfast - get a takeaway from one of the nearby shops or eat breakfast at one of the diner's for a much better deal. Don't ask the hotel to book a minibus to the airport - take's much too long and the driver is likely to make detours to do his own shopping or get fuel! Get a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “great location- very quiet”
Reviews.Author: beachwalkers
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in Jan 07 and found the location excellent. The rooms are smalll but very clean and extremely quiet- no traffic noise . Good comfortable bed and very good shower. Staff are very knowledgable and helpful- provide any details you need such as which bus to catch etc. The attached reatuarant is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: imakebeer
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean and the staff friendly. The room was regular sized. The bathroom was clean and the shower had good water pressure. We especially liked the free skin softener after spending two days at the beach in the hot Australian sun. The hotel is located with walking distance of Darling Harbor, Paddy's Markets and Chinatown. It is near the Town Hall train stop which is only two stops away from Circular Quay. A quick ride on the train and a short hop on a bus will get you to Bondi Beach in about 30 minutes. We had trouble with the air conditioning and it didn't work for three of the five nights. We were moved to a different room after the first room's A/C failed. When that room's A/C did not work either, the staff brought us a fan which helped a lot. The problem was system wide and was eventually fixed. We also had trouble making a phone call. When we went to the front desk the clerk came with us to our room and verified that the phone was not working properly so he brought us downstairs and made sure we were able to make our call on another phone. We had some issues but the staff really did their best to resolve them to the best of their ability. We stayed here for five nights and we'd stay in this hotel again. At AUD $145 a night it was the cheapest hotel with the best overall location.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: lt.ripley
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from reviews; the location seemed to attract people and we only had three days in Sydney. When we first arrived I discoverd that I had forgotten my camera on the transerbuss, and the staff were on it directly. I got my camera back some hour later! The room (superiour queen) was build kind of weird but spacious and comfy, and clean. The location is GREAT and so is the staff, and we got it to a decent price (140 aus dollar/night). I really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Imagined and Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Romanchick
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for one week and wanted a decent hotel in a good location. Well The Metro Hotel at 300 Pitt Street met our expectations. It was literally in the center of the city with a huge park 2 blocks away to relax and feel in nature. The main shopping drag with the big department stores was 3 blocks away. We had breakfast every morning in the QVB (Queen Victoria Building which is one block away. This is a beautiful old building converted into an upscale shopping establishment. Very nice!!! LOCATION: The main Sydney Central Rail Station is a 15 minute walk down Pitt Street or a 5 minute bus ride. There is also a train stop which is about 2 blocks away and the monorail which runs along Pitt Street. The Rocks area/Sydney Opera House/Waterfront area is about a 25 minute walk along George Street which parallels Pitt St. If you like to walk this may seem like a nice stroll, however, if you normally drive, then I would recommend any bus that goes down George street and it will be a 10 minute bus ride. ROOMS: Although some of the reviews say the room are small, we had a pretty decent size room with the bed in the center and room to walk around and put luggage. We had room 609 which faced the back of the building which we loved because it was extremely quiet!! It was great!!! The room had a refrigerator, air conditioning, and a safe which cost $2.50 per day. The room was very clean and the daily bottle water left by our bedside was a really nice touch. There is also an electric tea kettle, with tea bags, wine glasses, champagne flutes, tea cups. This hotel is not fancy by any means, but they have put some thought into practical, complilmentary little necessities that come in nicely. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel that is close to several attractions”
Reviews.Author: pixie_06
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel stay in Australia and we were quite impressed with how nice and clean the hotel was. The rooms run on the small side and if you're not on the street side, there isn't much sunlight, but the rooms are modern and the beds are comfortable. If you are planning to just sleep there and spend most of the day out and about, you won't mind the small room given the great value. The staff are very friendly and helpful to direct you with how to get to places. In terms of location, it's within walking distance to Central Station(15min), Town Hall Station, Darling Harbour and Chinatown and lots of great Asian and Spanish food in the area. Also, we found an internet cafe right down the street that charges only $1.50/hr AUD.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Cretey
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel in the centre of Sydney - beware though, this hotel is at the opposite end of Pitt St to the Opera House - long walk! Rooms are small but clean. Accommodation was reasonably priced for being central city. The guy serving brekkie downstairs was a bit grumpy but I hope this wasn't regular service levels! Reception staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its price”
Reviews.Author: AussieWalker
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a short city break in Sydney. Hotel is conveniently located on Pitt St a few blocks down from Pitt St Mall and right amongst all the other shopping in town. Also located a shorts stroll from Chinatown and Paddy's market. Both my bf and I are walkers and enjoyed everything being within decent walking distance. About a 45min walk to Newtown, 20 mins to circular Quay. Right around the corner from Woolworths for any self catering needs. Hotel itself was very decent compared to prices of other hotels in Sydney. Room was very clean, heating in room was OK although at times a little loud. There was a small selection of cable TV channels. Our regular room had no views but also no outside noise which was good. Foyer of hotel seems very busy and there are always people milling about although I guess thats because there is a restaurant/cafe downstairs open to the public. Lift to access the hotel rooms requires use of a room key which is good although easy enough for anyone to follow another person into the lift. overall would stay here for the convenience and price.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice and classy”
Reviews.Author: kennywah
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked our second leg during our stay in Sydney here at the Metro from July 23-25, 2006. I heard of this hotel on this website and from the overwhelming positve reviews, i booked it. Just as promised, the hotel was very nice. A nice, elegant but simple lobby. Staff were friendly and helpful. We were in a queen size room with no view at all but the room was good enough. Nice sheets and comforter. A little small considering we were both lugging around a total of 6 pieces of luggage. The room was quiet and clean. We were able to set the thermostat but the forced air was a bit on the loud side. The hotel is situated in the heart of the business district within steps of chinatown, darling harbor, numerous restaurants and bars, etc. We walked all over and we were still quite close to the opera house, botanical gardens, Circular Quay, and the Rocks. There is a restaurant on the ground floor called Paradiso and it was quite lovely. They offer breakfast, lunch, and dinner and it is quite affordable. One night i had prawns in a lime, chili marinara llinguine and she had the grilled baby octopus and both plates were under $20 AUD. Breakfast was also good and goes for about $10 AUD. There are several hotels nearby but this one is truly a good balance between price and quality. A very lovely hotel and a lovelier price. I recommend very strongly. FYI Make sure you don't confuse this hotel with the other Metro Hotel further south. It is not very nice looking, it is in a shadier part of town, but still shares the same name and street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in July, and it was great. The room itself was tiny; it was fine for one person with not much luggage, but if there was more than one of me or I had more than two bags, I would pay more for the larger room. But it was a nicely-appointed room, and the location was very good, just a block or two away from two different metro stations, and also convenient to the monorail (whose noise I never noticed). Lots of places to eat nearby, as well as cheap Internet cafes. Elevator access was through your room key, so security was good (although I was out both very late and very early and didn't have any qualms about the neighborhood). I absolutely loved Sydney, and this hotel was part of why I enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good for it's price”
Reviews.Author: Milolicious
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights in Sydney. Good value for money. Got a budget room apparently which was only about AUD110 a night, and although it didn't have much of a view (or any view at all, actually), I think it made the room a lot more quiet than it would have been if it'd been facing the main road. Staff were efficient, although not all THAT warm. But good if you're the sort of person that's not very interested in front-desk smalltalk anyway. Rooms were very nice. Just right for one-person, maybe a bit of a squeeze for two or more though. Best thing about it was the location. Very central to everything. Take the train from the airport to Town Hall station if you wanna save an extra AUD20 or so. Pretty short walk even for a girl with two bags, a handbag, and a laptop case.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: RichardOrmson
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a "superior" room at the Metro on Pitt for a week at the start of June 06. I was impressed with the location - only a few blocks from Darling harbour, Pitt Street Mall China town and Hyde Park - albeit all in different directions! It's also right on the Monorail line. At AU$ 120 per night, you can't get a much better spot. The room was nicely sized for a mid range hotel, and very clean. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was shower only, but it was a nice large walk in shower, with good pressure and plenty of hot water. Internet connection is available in all the rooms (at extra cost - less than 10 AU$ per day) and worked reliably. Reception staff were helpful and polite. The hotel does have its own restaurant, but with the number of other options in the area I never got around to trying it. The only slight drawback is that the street outside can be quite noisy - as noted earlier the Monorail is there (and starts at 6.30am), but it's also one of the main roads into the central business district. If you are a light sleeper it would be advisable to ask for a room away from the street (most of them are). I didn't have a problem with the noise level in a street facing room, but I am sure that some people will. Also note that Metro is part of a chain, and there are two of them on Pitt Street - Metro on Pitt and Metro Central - which can cause confusion if you are using taxis or airport shuttles! Overall a nice mid range hotel, very good value for the level of accomodation in this location

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EveryOtherYear
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay. Hotel was very centrally located, clean and modern. Reception staff were exceptionally helpful - providing assistance well in excess of that expected. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Metro on 300 Pitt Street and found it to be great value and in a great location. We paid about Â£65 a night for a central Sydney hotel with everything in walking distance. Yes rooms are small if you like hanging around in them so if you want something bigger then pay for it! You're obviously going to check out all the normal sights but if you get a chance go to the Chinese Gardens at Darling Harbour (10 min walk from the hotel) - go on a bright sunny day when you need a chill - it's an oasis of tranquility in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyholsfolks!
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in March 2006. Found it really hard to get accommodation in Sydney that didn't cost a fortune - so was really glad to get this hotel via Wotif. Be careful though - there are two metro hotels on Pitt St (caused our taxi driver some confusion), but we arrived at 300 Pitt St to be welcomed by very friendly staff. There is no doubt about it - the rooms here are small. We reserved a standard queen as it suited our needs fine (mind you had to walk carefully around suitcases at night), but if you need space reserve a superior room. Cleanliness and toiletries provided were excellent. Breakfast at adjoining bar was good. Compared prices at some nearby cafes, and hotel breakfast seemed good value. About a 20 minute walk straight down Pitt St to circular quay. We didn't mind this (a good bit of exercise to start the day) - but it depends where you want to be. The monorail terminal is just a few blocks the opposite way down Pitt St giving access to Darling harbour area. Both Pitt St and street parallel to it excellent for shopping. I liked this hotel and would probably stay here again, if we ever go back to Sydney.

HotelInfo.Name: Metro Hotel on Pitt
HotelInfo.Address: 300 Pitt Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Pentura on Pitt)
